thread.title: £300,000 in Lottery money to help projects in the East
thread.title_full: £300,000 in Lottery money to help projects in the East | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: £300,000 in Lottery money to help projects in the East
text:
Play video Video report by ITV News Anglia's Helen Keenan £300,000 of Heritage Lottery money is coming to the East to help community projects to protect, bees, ponds and trees.
One of those receiving a share of the funding is the Norfolk Urban Peregrine Project at Norwich Cathedral.
Around £86,000 is being invested to help with monitoring the falcons behaviour.
Around £86,000 is being invested to help with monitoring the falcons behaviour. Credit: Norfolk Urban Peregrine Project Full list of the projects receiving funding:
All the buzz in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk. SAW Trust awarded £9,700 Cedars Park pond revival in Broxbourne, Hertfordshire. Friends of Cedar Park awarded £59,700 Natural world of the Wensum in Fakenham, Norfolk. Pensthorpe Conservation Trust awarded £53,500 Nene Park: moments with trees in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire. Nene Park Trust awarded £99,500 Norfolk urban peregrine project in Norwich, Norfolk. Hawk and Owl Trust awarded £86,700 Last updated Mon 27 Feb 2017 Essex Hertfordshire
